name: StarCraft 2 League Table
description:
Create a custom SC2 League.

Just add the players and the games. The table is automatically updated with the information. Also the ability to sort and filter the data how you see fit.

How to use:

Select new league and input league name, name can be changed later if needed.

Click on the settings button in the top right and input the player name and select an icon. Submit will not work if  the fields are empty or if the name already exists.

To add game :

settings add game,  If clicking confirm doesn't do anything it means either: Some input fields are empty, or a player is in both dropdowns.

You will need to add a map what can be done on this screen, there is currently no way to edit or delete the map in the program. To do this go to the games files StarCraftLeague_Data and open the JSON file with the league name, search for "maps" and edit the data within the [] eg. "maps":["Map1","Map2"].

The comment and the Time boxes do not need to be populated for it to work.

You can Swap between the leaderboard and game list by clicking on the Leaderboard/gamlist tittle.

Clicking on either the Player or the Game in the list will open up the viewer, you can edit the game/player from this screen by clicking on the name at the top.

There's a hide feature if you would like to see how the league would look without a certain player or game (this removes the player/game from the leaderboard as well as not including any game this player has played in). You can unhide a player/game from the settings dropdown menu.

There is an option to Delete as well if needed.

There's a filter feature in the top right:

The player filter populates the league table with each players data against the filtered player.

The race filter populates the league table by how a player plays as a race  (Zerg Vs) or how a player is against that race (Vs Zerg)
